alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Bulloch; Candler; Evans; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 2:32PM EDT until August 30 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Bulloch, Candler, Evans, Jenkins, Screven and Tattnall. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated widespread rains associated with Hurricane Idalia expanding across much of interior Southeast Georgia. Up to 3 inches of rain has fallen in some areas today and the risk for flooding will steadily increase this afternoon as the center of Idalia moves into Southeast Georgia. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Statesboro, Reidsville, Metter, Glennville, Millen, Sylvania, Claxton, Butts, Brooklet, Hagan, Portal, Collins, Cobbtown, Pulaski, Register, Rocky Ford, Daisy, Bellville, Manassas and Hopeulikit.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
